ivory.core.data.index
Interface PostingsReader

All Known Implementing Classes:
PostingsListDocSortedNonPositional.PostingsReader, PostingsListDocSortedPositional.PostingsReader, PostingsListDocSortedPositionalPForDelta.PostingsReader, ProximityPostingsReader, ProximityPostingsReaderOrderedWindow, ProximityPostingsReaderUnorderedWindow
public interface PostingsReader

Interface for a postings reader.

Author:
Jimmy Lin

Method Summary
 int getDocno()
          Returns the docno of the current posting.
 int getNumberOfPostings()
          Returns the number of postings in this postings list.
 int[] getPositions()
          Returns an array of term positions corresponding to the current posting.
 boolean getPositions(TermPositions tp)
          Loads a TermPositions object corresponding to the current posting.
 PostingsList getPostingsList()
          Returns the PostingsList associated with this reader.
 short getTf()
          Returns the score corresponding to the current posting.
 boolean hasMorePostings()
          Checks to see if there are any more postings to be read.
 boolean nextPosting(Posting posting)
          Reads the next posting, consuming it from the stream of postings.
 int peekNextDocno()
          Returns the docno of the next posting, without consuming it from the stream of postings.
 short peekNextTf()
          Returns the score of the next posting, without consuming it from the stream of postings.
 void reset()
          Resets this object to start reading from the first posting.
 

Method Detail

getDocno

int getDocno()
Returns the docno of the current posting.

Returns:
docno of the current posting.

getNumberOfPostings

int getNumberOfPostings()
Returns the number of postings in this postings list. Note that this value may not be the same as the document frequency of the term (e.g., if this postings list contains only a partition of the entire collection).

Returns:
number of postings

getPositions

int[] getPositions()
Returns an array of term positions corresponding to the current posting. This is an optional operation valid only for postings that store positional information.

Returns:
array of term positions

getPositions

boolean getPositions(TermPositions tp)
Loads a TermPositions object corresponding to the current posting. This is an optional operation valid only for postings that store positional information.

Returns:
{code true} if there are any more postings to be read, false otherwise

getPostingsList

PostingsList getPostingsList()
Returns the PostingsList associated with this reader.

Returns:
PostingsList associated with this reader

getTf

short getTf()
Returns the score corresponding to the current posting.

Returns:
term frequency of the current posting

hasMorePostings

boolean hasMorePostings()
Checks to see if there are any more postings to be read.

Returns:
true if there are any more postings to be read, false otherwise

nextPosting

boolean nextPosting(Posting posting)
Reads the next posting, consuming it from the stream of postings.

Parameters:
posting - object for holding the posting
Returns:
true if posting successfully read, false otherwise

peekNextDocno

int peekNextDocno()
Returns the docno of the next posting, without consuming it from the stream of postings. This is an optional operation.

Returns:
docno of the next posting

peekNextTf

short peekNextTf()
Returns the score of the next posting, without consuming it from the stream of postings. This is an optional operation.

Returns:
term frequency of the next posting

reset

void reset()
Resets this object to start reading from the first posting.
